text:
FACE SHEET
Patient Name: John Doe
DOB: 01/15/1960
SSN: XXX-XX-1234
Address: 123 Main St, Anytown, NE 68000
Phone: (402) 555-0123
Insurance: Blue Cross Blue Shield
Policy: BCB-123456789
Employer: Acme Manufacturing
Occupation: Assembly Line Worker
Date of Injury: 12/01/2023

HISTORY AND PHYSICAL
Chief Complaint: Lower back pain radiating to left leg
HPI: 55-year-old male assembly line worker presenting with chronic lower back pain following a work injury on 12/01/2023. Reports lifting a heavy box when he felt a sharp pain in his lower back. Pain radiates down the left leg to the knee.
PMH: Hypertension (controlled), Type 2 Diabetes
Medications: Metformin 1000mg BID, Lisinopril 20mg daily
Allergies: NKDA
Social History: Non-smoker, occasional alcohol use

PROGRESS NOTE - 2024-01-15
Vitals: BP 130/85, HR 72, Temp 98.6F, SpO2 98%
Subjective: Patient reports persistent lower back pain, 7/10 severity. Difficulty standing for extended periods. Unable to perform work duties.
Objective: Antalgic gait. Tenderness over L4-L5 region. Positive straight leg raise on left at 45 degrees.
Assessment: Chronic lumbar radiculopathy, L4-L5 disc herniation (confirmed by MRI)
Plan: Continue conservative treatment. Start physical therapy 3x/week. Gabapentin 300mg TID added.

PROGRESS NOTE - 2024-02-10
Vitals: BP 128/82, HR 70, Temp 98.4F, SpO2 99%
Subjective: Patient reports gradual improvement with physical therapy. Pain now 5/10. Able to walk 30 minutes without significant pain.
Objective: Improved range of motion. Negative straight leg raise bilaterally.
Assessment: Improving lumbar radiculopathy with PT
Plan: Continue PT. Discuss return to light duty work at 6 weeks. Taper Gabapentin if improvement continues.

LABORATORY REPORT
Date: 2024-01-15
Ordering Physician: Dr. Smith

CBC:
  WBC: 7.2 x10^3/uL (4.5-11.0)
  RBC: 4.8 x10^6/uL (4.5-5.5)
  Hemoglobin: 14.2 g/dL (13.5-17.5)
  Hematocrit: 42.1% (38.8-50.0)
  Platelets: 245 x10^3/uL (150-400)

CMP:
  Glucose: 142 mg/dL (70-100) HIGH
  BUN: 18 mg/dL (7-20)
  Creatinine: 1.0 mg/dL (0.7-1.3)
  HbA1c: 7.2% (< 5.7) HIGH
  Sodium: 140 mEq/L (136-145)
  Potassium: 4.2 mEq/L (3.5-5.0)

IMAGING REPORT
MRI Lumbar Spine without Contrast
Date: 2024-01-10
Ordering Physician: Dr. Smith
Indication: Lower back pain with left leg radiculopathy

Findings:
- L4-L5: Central and left paracentral disc herniation measuring 8mm. Moderate compression of the left L5 nerve root. Moderate foraminal stenosis on the left.
- L5-S1: Mild disc bulge without significant stenosis.
- L3-L4: Normal disc height and signal. No stenosis.
- Conus medullaris terminates at L1-L2, normal.
- No fracture or listhesis.

Impression: L4-L5 disc herniation with left L5 radiculopathy. Moderate left foraminal stenosis.

MEDICATION LIST
Current Medications as of 2024-02-10:
1. Ibuprofen 800mg TID (for pain)
2. Gabapentin 300mg TID (for neuropathic pain)
3. Cyclobenzaprine 10mg QHS (muscle relaxant)
4. Metformin 1000mg BID (diabetes)
5. Lisinopril 20mg daily (hypertension)
6. Aspirin 81mg daily (cardioprotective)

Discontinued:
- Tramadol 50mg (discontinued 2024-01-20 due to inadequate relief)

PHYSICAL THERAPY NOTES
Session 8 of 12 - Date: 2024-02-08
Therapist: Sarah Johnson, PT, DPT

Objective Measurements:
- Lumbar flexion: 55 degrees (baseline: 40 degrees)
- Lumbar extension: 20 degrees (baseline: 5 degrees)
- Left SLR: 70 degrees (baseline: 45 degrees)
- Pain during activity: 4/10 (baseline: 8/10)

Treatment: Core stabilization exercises, lumbar traction (15 min), ultrasound therapy

Progress: Patient demonstrating steady improvement. Range of motion improved 15 degrees in extension. Pain levels decreased from 8/10 to 4/10 during activity.

Goals: Return to light duty work by session 12. Continue home exercise program.

OPERATIVE REPORT
Date: 2024-03-15
Surgeon: Dr. Robert Chen, MD
Assistant: Dr. Emily Park, MD
Anesthesia: General
Procedure: L4-L5 Microdiscectomy

Indication: Failed conservative treatment for L4-L5 disc herniation with persistent left L5 radiculopathy.

Findings: Large central disc herniation with significant compression of left L5 nerve root. Free disc fragment noted and removed.

Procedure Details: Standard left-sided approach. Laminotomy performed at L4-L5. Herniated disc material and free fragment removed. Nerve root decompressed with good pulse noted.

EBL: 50mL
Complications: None
Disposition: Recovery room in stable condition

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Admitted: 03/15/2024
Discharged: 03/17/2024
Attending: Dr. Robert Chen, MD

Diagnosis: L4-L5 disc herniation, status post microdiscectomy

Hospital Course: Patient underwent uneventful L4-L5 microdiscectomy. Post-operative course was unremarkable. Patient was ambulatory POD1 with significant improvement in left leg pain.

Condition at Discharge: Stable, improved. Left leg pain resolved. Mild incisional tenderness.

Discharge Medications:
- Oxycodone 5mg Q6H PRN pain (7-day supply)
- Ibuprofen 800mg TID
- Gabapentin 300mg TID (taper over 2 weeks)
- Continue home medications

Follow-up: Dr. Chen in 2 weeks. Resume PT at 6 weeks post-op.
Activity: No lifting > 10 lbs for 6 weeks. No driving while on narcotics.
Expected return to work: 8-12 weeks post-surgery
